I have just seen your letter of July 19 together with the
correspondence from Minnesota Mining & Manufacturing.
I think that Anderson's suggestions are excellent and I
think a good picture spread of tape network activities
would go very well indeed. What is important for you to tell
Anderson, however, is not to use the term "your own FM
radio station". He ought to use the terml'your owneducational
radio station".
As I have written to you previously there is a great deal of
talk at NBC of converting the entire network to a tape operation.
Hence this kind of material would be of tremendous interest.
You might remind Anderson too that the trade press would
probably be very much interested including Broadcasting. * Â» $
